question_description: You need to optimize batch file transfers into Cloud Storage for Mountkirk Games' new Google Cloud solution. The batch files  contain game statistics that need to be staged in Cloud Storage and be processed by an extract transform load (ETL) tool.  What should you do?

options.A: Use gsutil to batch move files in sequence.
options.B: Use gsutil to batch copy the files in parallel.
options.C: Use gsutil to extract the files as the first part of ETL.
options.D: Use gsutil to load the files as the last part of ETL.

question_description: You are implementing Firestore for Mountkirk Games. Mountkirk Games wants to give a new game programmatic access to a  legacy game's Firestore database.   Access should be as restricted as possible. What should you do?

options.A: Create a service account (SA) in the legacy game's Google Cloud project, add a second SA in the new game's IAM page,  and then give the Organization Admin role to both SAs.
options.B: Create a service account (SA) in the legacy game's Google Cloud project, give the SA the Organization Admin role, and  then give it the Firebase Admin role in both projects.
options.C: Create a service account (SA) in the legacy game's Google Cloud project, add this SA in the new game's IAM page, and  then give it the Firebase Admin role in both projects.
options.D: Create a service account (SA) in the legacy game's Google Cloud project, give it the Firebase Admin role, and then  migrate the new game to the legacy game's project.

question_description: Mountkirk Games wants to limit the physical location of resources to their operating Google Cloud regions. What should you  do?

options.A: Configure an organizational policy which constrains where resources can be deployed.
options.B: Configure IAM conditions to limit what resources can be configured.
options.C: Configure the quotas for resources in the regions not being used to 0.
options.D: Configure a custom alert in Cloud Monitoring so you can disable resources as they are created in other regions.

question_description: You need to implement a network ingress for a new game that meets the defined business and technical requirements.  Mountkirk Games wants each regional game instance to be located in multiple Google Cloud regions. What should you do?

options.A: Configure a global load balancer connected to a managed instance group running Compute Engine instances.
options.B: Configure kubemci with a global load balancer and Google Kubernetes Engine.
options.C: Configure a global load balancer with Google Kubernetes Engine.
options.D: Configure Ingress for Anthos with a global load balancer and Google Kubernetes Engine.

question_description: Your development teams release new versions of games running on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) daily. You want to create  service level indicators (SLIs) to evaluate the quality of the new versions from the user's perspective. What should you do?

options.A: Create CPU Utilization and Request Latency as service level indicators.
options.B: Create GKE CPU Utilization and Memory Utilization as service level indicators.
options.C: Create Request Latency and Error Rate as service level indicators.
options.D: Create Server Uptime and Error Rate as service level indicators.

question_description: Mountkirk Games wants you to secure the connectivity from the new gaming application platform to Google Cloud. You want to  streamline the process and follow   Google-recommended practices. What should you do?

options.A: Configure Workload Identity and service accounts to be used by the application platform.
options.B: Use Kubernetes Secrets, which are obfuscated by default. Configure these Secrets to be used by the application  platform.
options.C: Configure Kubernetes Secrets to store the secret, enable Application-Layer Secrets Encryption, and use Cloud Key  Management Service (Cloud KMS) to manage the encryption keys. Configure these Secrets to be used by the application  platform.
options.D: Configure HashiCorp Vault on Compute Engine, and use customer managed encryption keys and Cloud Key Management  Service (Cloud KMS) to manage the encryption keys. Configure these Secrets to be used by the application platform.

question_description: Your development team has created a mobile game app. You want to test the new mobile app on Android and iOS devices with  a variety of configurations. You need to ensure that testing is efficient and cost-effective. What should you do?

options.A: Upload your mobile app to the Firebase Test Lab, and test the mobile app on Android and iOS devices.
options.B: Create Android and iOS VMs on Google Cloud, install the mobile app on the VMs, and test the mobile app.
options.C: Create Android and iOS containers on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE), install the mobile app on the containers, and  test the mobile app.
options.D: Upload your mobile app with different configurations to Firebase Hosting and test each configuration.
